CatDescriptText: Miss Juanita Means, school teacher, 624 Morgan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" answer reads: "I think it should be declared illegal. The morals of our society are at its lowest ebb now.  Legal marriage needs to be, and should be, encouraged for the bettermeant [sic] of society and the children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Juanita Means, wearing light colored coat with lapels and two row button trim, and button down dress with collar, standing in front of brick wall
